WRITING.TEXT:
I picked my goal weight because it was the weight I was at before I got horribly depressed. I have this idea that it will make me happy again. Except I know that it won't make me happy because I will be really sick at that point.
I have had the same goal weight since my ed has started. I never reached it, and I probably never will

I only started having problems when my bmi was around 14. I'm always cold, I have chest pains, light headedness, low electrolytes, rapid heart rate, low blood pressure. I have a whole swath of problems because of my low weight. But it never got bad until I got down down to around 14

I decided to do an oatmeal mono today and tomorrow. I decided to do this for 2 reasons, first because apparently mono diets are good way to lose weight fast and secondly because I have diarrhea (sorry tmi) because of new medication and oatmeal always helps when I have diarrhea
Yeah, I watch a lot of Netflix and I'm reading Harry Potter right now! Thanks
Yeah, it's my first time. They said it would probably be in 3 to 6 weeks, but that it could be more or less time
No idea. I could get the call in a few days or in a few weeks

I'm alright, pretty tired and bored though. I'm feeling pretty sick because of some new medication. I have a few doctors appointments today.
I'm just so tired of everything. I just want to get admitted to my treatment program, but I have no idea when that will be. I'm tired of waiting and doing nothing all day.
I'm also doing an oatmeal mono today.
There's a bunch of apps that help to learn new languages. You should check it out
Put a heating pad or a hot water bottle on your stomach, it'll help with the bloating and pain

WRITING.TITLE: Has anyone ever done a mono?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm thinking of doing a mono diet and I was wondering if anyone had any experience with them?
I'm thinking of doing either a chocolate, peanut butter, oatmeal or egg mono.
If anyone has any insight, I'd love to hear it
Edit: I've decided that I will do an oatmeal mono tomorrow
I have a pretty face, people always tell me I should be a model

Breakfast: Oatmeal with brown sugar and cocoa (147)
Lunch: Egg whites with partially skim mozzarella and sriracha (120), celery, red bell pepper and cucumber (25)
Dinner: Peanut sesame shirataki noodles (144)
Snacks: Rice cake with 1 1/2 tbsp light peanut butter (155), diet coke (0) and mio sport (0)
Total: 591 calories
That it's about food and weight, when really the obsession with food and weight is just a symptom of a bigger problem

I definitely think that bulimia is much harder on the body than anorexia. When I was bulimic I felt much worse physically than I do now with my anorexia.
I used to purge everything that I ate. There were times when I couldn't even stand up or do anything. I remember having to crawl around my house because I couldn't stand up. I couldn't open doors or do anything really.
Now with my restriction, I am much thinner than I was when I was bulimic, but I feel better physically. I don't have to crawl around and I can do more things than when I was bulimic.

Breakfast: Oatmeal with brown sugar and cocoa (147)

You will most likely still get a period when you lose weight. It might be lighter though.
It definitely sounds like you have disordered eating, but we aren't doctors and can't diagnose you

Yeah, I've had about 550 cals today. But I still want to binge, I honestly hate this binge/restrict cycle that I'm in. Plus I'm pretty sure I'm gaining weight, which upsets me and triggers me to binge more.
Sorry for ranting
Yeah, I'm having a hard time resisting. I'm worried I'll binge when my mom goes to bed because that's usually when I binge. I've been wanting to binge all day since I binged last night

I was planning to binge today too, but I've resisted the urges up to now, but I don't know if I'll be able to resist for the rest of the day
Good job on resisting, hopefully I'll be as strong as you
Protein is good, if you're restricting you should try to get as much protein as possible. I eat egg whites and peanut butter for my protein.

I binged on peanut butter last night. I ate wayyyyy more than 800 cals worth of the stuff, plus cheese and bread. I kind of want to keep binging today, but I know I shouldn't.
Good luck on your final, you'll do great!

I'm feeling pretty depressed too. And I'm super bloated these days and I don't know why.
Sorry you feel this way. Hope you feel better soon

Awesome, thanks! This is great because I don't have access to a scale, so measurements are my way of tracking my progress.

I only take them if I haven't had a bm in over a week. Laxatives don't help you lose weight. Your food and calories are absorbed in your small intestines, while laxatives act on your large intestine. So by the time it gets to your large intestine it's completely absorbed already
This is great! I will definitely use it everyday. It would be really cool if we could enter other measurements, such as waist, hips, bust, etc.

Urg, today I've been binging a lot. I had starbucks with a cookie and croissant! Then I had some calamari, a grilled cheese, peanut butter, cheese, yam fries, just sooo much food. I'm pretty angry at myself.
I decided that I will have 800 cals tomorrow and I will decrease by 100 cals each day until I reach 400. Then I will stay at 400 for a while. I'm also planning to have a few fasts after I get this under control.

Your comments are on point today!!! I think I will listen to you and start at 800 tomorrow and go down by 100 cals each day.
I wish it was nice here. We had a super mild winter up to now, but this weekend winter came and it is -40C with the wind these days. So going to the park won't be a great idea, haha.
Thanks

It is! I just have so many cravings all day long, I used to never have that. Hopefully we both find our will power soon!
Thanks, I'm excited and nervous to go into treatment, but I need to do it
Thanks! It's something I know it's something I need to do so I can live the life I truly want.

Thanks, I think I'm going to start at 800 cals tommorrow and go down by 100 each day.

WRITING.TITLE: I keep binging and I don't know why
WRITING.TEXT:
Since Christmas I've been able to restrict for about 5 days then I go and binge. I don't know why I keep binging, I'm not upset about anything, I'm not forced to eat, I'm not hungry, but I binge after about 5 days of restricting. It's making me so angry. Before Christmas I went over 3 weeks binge-free but now I can't even go 1 week.
I'm debating between starting at 800 cals tomorrow and go down by 100 cals each day until I reach zero and fast for a day or two or if I should just stick to 400 cals a day for a while with a few fast days in there. What do you guys think?
Also, thought I'd give a treatment update. I had my assessment last week and my meeting with my nurse-therapist today. I will be going into inpatient treatment soon for weight restoration then continue in their day program. They said I'll probably be admitted in about 3 weeks, maybe more, maybe less. So we'll see, I'll be sad to be leaving this great community, but I need to do this.
I love smoking! It keeps me sane and I love how it suppresses my appetite
I'd like to be 84lbs by then
